member.name: T:Kentor.AuthServices.Configuration.IdentityProviderDictionary
member.summary: A thread safe wrapper around a dictionary for the identity providers.
member.remarks: First I thought about using a ConcurrentDictionary, but that does not maintain any order of the added objects. Since the first idp added becomes the default idp, the order must be preserved. And there has to be queuing semantics if the first idp is dynamically loaded from a federation and later removed. Locks are simple and this part of the code shouldn't be that performance sensitive.

member.name: T:Kentor.AuthServices.Saml2P.Saml2PSecurityTokenHandler
member.summary: Somewhat ugly subclassing to be able to access some methods that are protected on Saml2SecurityTokenHandler. The public interface of Saml2SecurityTokenHandler expects the actual assertion to be signed, which is not always the case when using Saml2-P. The assertion can be embedded in a signed response. Or the signing could be handled at transport level.

member.param: The token to translate to claims.
member.returns: An identity with the created claims.

member.summary: Detect if a token is replayed (i.e. reused). The token is added to the list of used tokens, so this method should only be called once for each token.
